channel.title: ArrayList<Integer> help
channel.description: Okay so I'm adding a lottery feature. When you get a ticket it's supposed to add your ticket number to an array. Problem is, when you look at the array, it only shows your number. How can I get it to show all the numbers added to said array?

item.title: ArrayList<Integer> help
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Shadowspkin, post:5, topic:393004”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=490172.msg3584320#msg3584320 date=1304042635]

You sure you looped the code where the # is added to the array? Not really fluent in java but in c# its something like you incr x by 1 each loop then you make a number = to lottoticket[ x];. Then in the same or different loop display lottoticket[ x]?

I’m not sure I understood you correctly, is this what you meant?

int num = Misc.random(20000);
for (int i = 0; i < numbersInGame.size(); i++)
		numbersInGame.add(num);

Davidi2, that would work but It’s going to be a weekly drawing of the winner, so the players lottery number would need to be saved, which couldn’t be done with your suggestion. (Unless, of course, I’m entirely wrong, and judging by my knowledge of Java, I probably am).
[/quote]

No his suggestion would not save. But if you’d tell us your Base and Gameframe that’d help, If its a PI im pretty sure you’d be making a save in player.java[/quote]What on earth are you talking about, it’s no different to save…

In fact my way would probably be just as easy if not easier to save…

Read full topic

item.title: ArrayList<Integer> help
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

You could always use a map to link a player to an integer. You could have the server save the map to a database.

Read full topic

item.title: ArrayList<Integer> help
item.dc:creator: @Shadowspkin Shadowspkin
item.description:
@Shadowspkin wrote:

Then if you have the save part down then use “David2’s” Suggestion and link it up with your save to make what you want?

Read full topic

item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“Shadowspkin, post:5, topic:393004”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=490172.msg3584320#msg3584320 date=1304042635]

You sure you looped the code where the # is added to the array? Not really fluent in java but in c# its something like you incr x by 1 each loop then you make a number = to lottoticket[ x];. Then in the same or different loop display lottoticket[ x]?

I’m not sure I understood you correctly, is this what you meant?

int num = Misc.random(20000);
for (int i = 0; i < numbersInGame.size(); i++)
		numbersInGame.add(num);

Davidi2, that would work but It’s going to be a weekly drawing of the winner, so the players lottery number would need to be saved, which couldn’t be done with your suggestion. (Unless, of course, I’m entirely wrong, and judging by my knowledge of Java, I probably am).
[/quote]

No his suggestion would not save. But if you’d tell us your Base and Gameframe that’d help, If its a PI im pretty sure you’d be making a save in player.java[/quote]

I have it saved already… Not what I needed help with…

Read full topic

item.title: ArrayList<Integer> help
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Rather then have an arraylist like that, have a normal array:
Player[] ticketArray = new Player[1000];
Then say, if a player draws ticket number 24, ticketArray[23] = player;

Read full topic
